extracted_playbook.condition: Are you a vendor or developer?

extracted_playbook.title: Identify Repeatedly Exploited Vulnerabilities
extracted_playbook.description: Perform an analysis of both CVEs and known exploited vulnerabilities to understand which classes of vulnerability are identified more than others.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Mitigations for Vulnerability Classes
extracted_playbook.description: Implement appropriate mitigations to eliminate identified classes of vulnerabilities, such as using parameterized queries for SQL injection.

extracted_playbook.title: Ensure Business Leaders are Responsible for Security
extracted_playbook.description: Business leaders should ensure proactive steps to eliminate entire classes of security vulnerabilities.

extracted_playbook.title: Follow SSDF and Implement Secure Design Practices
extracted_playbook.description: Implement secure design practices into each stage of the SDLC, including prioritizing memory safe languages and exercising due diligence when selecting software components.

extracted_playbook.title: Set Up Secure Development Team Practices
extracted_playbook.description: Conduct peer code reviews, work to a common organization secure coding standard, and maintain awareness of language-specific security concerns.

extracted_playbook.title: Establish a Vulnerability Disclosure Program
extracted_playbook.description: Verify and resolve security vulnerabilities disclosed by internal or external parties and establish processes to determine root causes.

extracted_playbook.title: Use SAST/DAST Tools
extracted_playbook.description: Use static and dynamic application security testing tools to analyze product source code and application behavior to detect error-prone practices.

extracted_playbook.title: Configure Production-Ready Products Securely
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure products have the most secure settings as default and provide guidance on the risks of changing each setting.

extracted_playbook.title: Prioritize Secure-by-Default Configurations
extracted_playbook.description: Eliminate default passwords, implement SSO technology, and provide high-quality audit logs to customers with no additional configuration.

extracted_playbook.title: Ensure Published CVEs Include Proper CWE Field
extracted_playbook.description: Include the proper CWE field in published CVEs to enable industry-wide analysis of software security and design flaws.

extracted_playbook.title: Document Secure Baseline Configurations
extracted_playbook.description: Document secure baseline configurations for all IT/OT components, including cloud infrastructure, and monitor deviations.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Regular Secure System Backups
extracted_playbook.description: Create known good copies of all device configurations for repairs and/or restoration, store copies off-network, and test regularly.

extracted_playbook.title: Update Software and Systems
extracted_playbook.description: Update software, operating systems, applications, and firmware on IT network assets in a timely manner.

extracted_playbook.title: Prioritize Patching of Known Exploited Vulnerabilities
extracted_playbook.description: Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities, especially those CVEs identified in this CSA.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Vendor-Approved Workarounds
extracted_playbook.description: If a patch for a known exploited or critical vulnerability cannot be quickly applied, implement vendor-approved workarounds.

extracted_playbook.title: Replace End-of-Life Software
extracted_playbook.description: Replace software that is no longer supported by the vendor.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Automated Asset Discovery
extracted_playbook.description: Routinely perform automated asset discovery across the entire estate to identify and catalogue all systems, services, hardware, and software.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Robust Patch Management Process
extracted_playbook.description: Establish a centralized patch management system that prioritizes patch applications.

extracted_playbook.title: Consider Moving Services to Reputable CSPs or MSPs
extracted_playbook.description: Organizations unable to perform rapid scanning and patching should consider moving services to reputable cloud or managed service providers.

extracted_playbook.title: Maintain Updated Cybersecurity Incident Response Plan
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure the incident response plan is tested at least annually and updated within a risk-informed time frame.

extracted_playbook.title: Enforce Phishing-Resistant MFA
extracted_playbook.description: Enforce phishing-resistant multifactor authentication for all users, without exception.

extracted_playbook.title: Enforce MFA on VPN Connections
extracted_playbook.description: Enforce MFA on all VPN connections. If unavailable, require strong passwords for remote work.

extracted_playbook.title: Review and Validate Privileged Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Regularly review, validate, or remove privileged accounts, at least annually.

extracted_playbook.title: Configure Access Control Under Least Privilege
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure software service accounts only provide necessary permissions to perform intended functions.

extracted_playbook.title: Properly Configure and Secure Internet-Facing Devices
extracted_playbook.description: Disable unused network ports and protocols, encrypt network traffic, and disable unused network services and devices.

extracted_playbook.title: Harden Commonly Exploited Network Services
extracted_playbook.description: Harden services like LLMNR, RDP, CIFS, Active Directory, and OpenLDAP.

extracted_playbook.title: Manage Windows KDC Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Manage accounts like KRBTGT to minimize Golden Ticket attacks and Kerberoasting.

extracted_playbook.title: Control Use of Native Scripting Applications
extracted_playbook.description: Strictly control the use of applications like command-line, PowerShell, WinRM, WMI, and DCOM.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Zero Trust Network Architecture
extracted_playbook.description: Limit or block lateral movement by controlling access to applications, devices, and databases.

extracted_playbook.title: Continuously Monitor Attack Surface
extracted_playbook.description: Investigate abnormal activity that may indicate cyber actor or malware lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Security Tools
extracted_playbook.description: Use tools like EDR, SIEM, and ITAM to ensure consistent asset reporting.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Web Application Firewalls
extracted_playbook.description: Monitor and filter web traffic to detect and mitigate exploitation attempts.

extracted_playbook.title: Monitor Unwanted Hardware and Software
extracted_playbook.description: Implement a policy or process to monitor against an allowlist with specified approved versions.

extracted_playbook.title: Use a Network Protocol Analyzer
extracted_playbook.description: Examine captured data, including packet-level data, to identify potential threats.

extracted_playbook.title: Reduce Third-Party Applications
extracted_playbook.description: Provide exceptions only if required to support business-critical functions.
